intro: Marah watsonii, commonly known as Watson's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Marah watsonii typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
